column4: hi, how can I remove an icoon from within my workgroup (network)
I try to do it manually and it says "Access Denied"
a user managed to get into my workgroup wirelessly (before I secured the connection)
what kind of workgroup is it?
I am asking on behalf of, I think its just an ordinary workgroup
how do you list the workgroup "icons"?
unsure sorry, I am asking on behalf of, and this guy is not too sure either, he just set it up
I am not local to his setup either
can he just open Nautilus with root permissions and delete it that way?

workgroup is afaik a M$ term for a group in the smb file and printer sharing service. he should find out the master browser of the group and restart it. but if the intruder is no more on the network, his icon in the workgroup is only a cosmetic problem
yeah, but its that cosmetic problem that he wants to get rid of
then he should restart all computers in the network to be sure, the master browser also got restarted  ;)
so on reboot, the master browser will search the network for all connected computers/nodes, and ONLY show the connected computers/nodes?
Im not 100% sure how Ubuntu does things, hence being here
after that a master browser will be elected and then collect the advertisements, afaik
ok, will tell him to try a reboot
